page.title: 02MARYC.FARMING LIVESTOCK'ROSE
page.content: The land is not very suitable for growing cereals or potatoes so farmers have turned to other "crops." Continental breeds of cattle such as Limousin, Simmental and Romagnolas can be seen. There are some goats, a small flock of Jacob's sheep and a mink farm. Managed forestry occupies areas where the land is rough. At Millbank the rose farm extends over 200 acres, the colourful fields being a brilliant sight all summer. Anderson's roses are sent to places as far afield as Canada, Japan, Australia. Over a million bushes are sold annually. New varieties are created by budding on to briar stock. Less skilful work such as weeding provides holiday jobs for local young folk.
